title: 27 MIN Orange Theory Inspired Treadmill Workout!
description:
Today we are doing a tough 27 MIN Orange Theory Inspired Tread Workout. If you have never been to an Orange Theory class, we highly recommend it! The treadmill section is usually half the class with the other half being rowing/floor exercises. Let us know how you like it!

Thanks to PopSugar for posting this workout: https://www.popsugar.com/fitness/Orangetheory-Treadmill-Workout-45523405

27:00 minutes of run and recovery intervals

All speeds and inclines are suggestions. Please stay safe and within your comfort zone!

Join our community of runners: http://www.ibxrunning.com
Merch: https://www.ibxrunning.com/store
IBX Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ibxrunning/
Veronica's Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/bodibyroni/
Rachael's Instragram: https://www.instagram.com/bedopefitness/

00:00 - Intro
00:37 - Warm Up
02:37 - Workout!
25:25 - Cool Down

Workout Structure:
Warmup: 2 minutes 
Part 1
      BASE PACE: 2 minutes - 4.5 - 6.5 mph
      PUSH PACE: 3 minutes - 5.5 - 7.5  mph
      BASE PACE: 2 minutes - 4.5 - 6.5 mph
      PUSH PACE: 3 minutes - 5.5 - 7.5  mph
      ALL OUT: 1 minute - 6.5 - 9.0  mph
Part 2 - Repeat 2 times
      BASE PACE: 1 minutes - 4.5 - 6.5 mph
      PUSH PACE: 1 minutes - 5.5 - 7.5  mph
      BASE PACE: 1 minutes - 4.5 - 6.5 mph
      PUSH PACE: 1 minutes - 5.5 - 7.5  mph
      ALL OUT: 1 minute - 6.5 - 9.0  mph
Cooldown at the end!

Songs Used:
1. Arms of Gold - Tape Machines
2. Dancing Till We Get Lost - Frigga
3. Dreams Are Gone - Gloria Tells
4. Evergreen Fields - Tape Machines
5. I'm Giving In To You - Loving Caliber
6. Me and My Army - Middle and End
7. No Good for Each Other - Mindme
8. Saharas - Hallmore
9. Still Feels Right - Flux Vortex

What did you enjoy about this workout? What suggestions do you have? We would love to hear from you below 👇

SUBSCRIBE to our Channel for more workouts!► https://www.youtube.com/c/IBXRunning/featured

Note: All information provided by IBX Running is of a general nature and is furnished only for educational/entertainment purposes only. channelDescription:
We are a community that wants to improve ourselves through running. Whether that improvement comes in the form of bettering our health, becoming more disciplined, creating a more positive attitude, or simply decreasing our mile times, the IBX Running community is welcoming and constructive. IBX Running knows that runners come in all shapes, sizes, and skill levels, and endeavors to be a place where members of our community can feel comfortable to strive to be better than they were last week, last month, and last year.

Newsletter: https://ibx-running.beehiiv.com/subscribe
Website:  https://www.ibxrunning.com
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ibxrunning/

comments: Ran this everyday for two weeks before a 5k on Sunday and my time improved by over 4 minutes.    Love this tread workout and the positivity!

I’m 57 and have dropped 25lbs thx to Ibex running and training by mind eliminate sugar and seriously cut carbs. This morning my wife told me that I’m looking great - is there better motivation than that?
OK, this was amazing!! The intervals, speed, and intensity were perfect! Absolutely loved this run! Please do more of these! Thank you for another wonderful workout!
Just did this for the first time. Fantastic!

#3 in the 7 day IBX challenge (see IBX's playlist) - done. I saw this one on the channel, but didn't run with it because I had my two lunchtime favorites "endurance run for weight loss" and "25 min treadmill HIIT (declining HIIT)". Switched it up today and did this Orange run followed by Rachael's declining HIIT. Good sweaty combo. I love Rachael's question... what are you trying to accomplish? It made me think... what would I be doing if I wasn't on this tread addiction? Hmmmm - wasting time surfing the net... staring in the refrigerator... NO buddy, not going back there. In the last year I've dusted off the treadmill and am down 35 pounds to a svelte 118 lbs. and stronger than ever! Yes I have to be my own cheerleader, but THANK YOU THANK YOU for IBX Running and Carolyn Girvan's YouTube channel with her strength training EPIC programs. As Veronica says... "LET'S GO RUNNERS!!!"
